j3l.util

Class TransformValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • j3l.util.TransformValue
  • Deprecated.

    @Deprecated
public final class TransformValue
extends java.lang.Object

    transforms primitive types to Strings, byte[], and char[], and vice versa

    e.g.:

    int i = 0xff00ff00;
    String s = TransformValue.toString(i);
    int j = TransformValue.toInteger(s);

    result: i == j is true!

    Since:
    JDK 1.8
    Version:
    2015.12.12_0
    Author:
    Johannes B. Latzel

        transforms an character-array of two elements to an int which is bitwise identical to the elements

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the 32 bit signed integral value which is bitwise identical to the character-array's elements
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when c == null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when c.length != 4

      • toByteArray

        public static byte[] toByteArray(java.lang.String s)
        Deprecated. 

        transforms a String to a bitwise identical byte[]

        note: the array will always have a length of s.length() * 2

        Parameters:
        s - the String
        Returns:
        a byte[] bitwise identical to the String s
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when s == null

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(byte[] b)
        Deprecated. 

        transforms a byte array of even length to a bitwise identical string

        Parameters:
        b - the byte array of even length
        Returns:
        the bitwise identical String
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when b == 0
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the length of the byte array is odd

      • toByteArray

        public static void toByteArray(java.lang.String s,
                               byte[] buffer)
        Deprecated. 

        writes a String into the buffer (a bitwise identical byte-array)

        note: the buffer must always have a length of s.length() * 2

        Parameters:
        s - the String
        buffer - a byte buffer of size s.length() * 2 (will be overwritten)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when buffer == null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when buffer.length != 8

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(byte[] b,
                                        char[] buffer)
        Deprecated. 

        writes a byte array of even length into a buffer (a bitwise identical character-array) and returns the String corresponding to the character-array

        note: the buffer must always have a length equal to the half of b.length

        Parameters:
        b - the byte array of even length
        buffer - a char buffer with a length equal to the half of b.length (will be overwritten)
        Returns:
        the bitwise identical String
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when buffer == null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when buffer.length * 2 != b.length
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the length of the byte array is odd
